meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a string.
meanings.sent1: The stringy cheese stretched as I pulled it apart.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was long and stringy, reaching down to her waist.
meanings.sent3: The stringy spaghetti tried to escape the plate, but I caught it!
meanings.sent4: The stringy clouds in the sky looked like wisps of cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The stringy texture of the fabric made it difficult to tear.

meanings.definition: Having long, thin strands or fibers.
meanings.sent1: The stringy vines climbed up the old brick wall.
meanings.sent2: The stringy seaweed washed ashore after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The stringy noodles danced in the boiling water.
meanings.sent4: Her stringy thoughts seemed to tangle and unravel in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The stringy roots of the tree spread out in all directions.

meanings.sent1: The stringy meat was hard to chew.
meanings.sent2: The stringy bark of the tree provided protection from the elements.
meanings.sent3: The stringy rope held strong despite the weight it carried.
meanings.sent4: His stringy excuses were easily seen through by everyone.
meanings.sent5: The stringy muscles in his arms bulged as he lifted the heavy weight.
